data.text: Avoid this Hotel , filthy rooms full of refugees very noisy the area where its located Is very unsafe to go out at night full of  criminals  out to Rob the tourists people are very Rude lots of pickpockets and prostitutes hanging around the Hotel
data.title: Dreadful place please ruined my holiday .

data.text: Hotel room was clean, all facilities as described. The hotel was well staffed who were efficient, very cooperative and helped with any support required for tours, public transport guidance and advice about local area. The hotel is in the city centre, area outside can be noisy as expected. The locals again were lively and very helpful, put up with my awful Turkish attempts. Cannot fault the location, hotel and staff all were just fabulous. There are local supermarkets, money exchange, train station and sightseeing all five minutes away
data.title: Wonderful holiday experience in Izmir

data.text:
We had difficulty finding the hotel as itâ€™s up a one way street. The hotel had been slightly modernised and the reception area was very welcoming 
Pros
Had valet parking
Reception very good and spoke English
Breakfast on ground floor very good range of foods considering
Room comfortable 
Kettle some tea bags  fridge safe hairdryer
Tv aircon very efficient and quiet. 
Lift to all floors

Metro not far from hotel well worth purchasing the Izmir card as this covers all transportation 
Few restaurants and bars to eat near by

Not a bad hotel for location 

Cons
Breakfast some of food cold ( boreks) very limited seating and gets packed when opens at 8.30
Bathroom although modern the step into it was horrendous nothing to hold onto and slippery 
Bar opposite hotel bit sleazy and can be noisy. 
Some of the bars around the hotel have women that come to talk to you and expect you to buy them drinks. Drinks much higher prices
data.title: Two nights in Izmir

data.text: The hotel itself was a comfortable the newish hotel down a very CD side street from the main drag they have obviously tried their hardest to upgrade the hotel which they've done not a bad job the reception and entrance area is clean tidy and very welcoming it has one lift that will serve all floors which is safe but be aware there is no internal door and you will see a moving wall on one side, on entering the room you will find a key card entry system with key card electricity controlling the fridge TV and air conditioning the air conditioning is maintained very well and works officially there is one English speaking news channel within the 40 plus channels on the television until very comfortable beds although the mattress are fast as firm, the bathroom is tight with millimeters to spare to close the door against the basin the wood used in the bathroom is obviously not of the type of that should be used in the bathroom bus the condition is shabby the shower is good with plenty of hot water and complementary shower gels and soaps if there are two of you in a room it would suggest that you will ask for an extra channel as they only supply you with one there is a fridge but no minibar one word of warning there is a very high step to get into the bathroom so if you have had a hip replacement or a knee replacement or you cannot lift your leg too high this may be a problem, we would not break the housekeeping too well as when we arrived there was pastrami left in the fridge when we checked in and only one cup for the tea and coffee making facilities this was however quickly rectified and the service we received from the staff was outstanding, breakfast is served from 7:00 a.m. till 10:00 a.m. and is over buffet style there is hot eggs turkey sausage plenty of different breads and simit, Jams honey's tea coffee and cereals, there is no parking of such but there is a concierge service that will park your car and retrieve it at a moment's notice this was highly recommended, the best way to get around is there is using the Izmir card which is available from the train station or the metro station which is just a 300 m walk from the hotel, we found this a great place to stay for a couple of days.
data.title: Great stay for two days

data.text:
On arrival told that the twin room booked was not available so 13yr old son and I had to share a double bed!
Room was much smaller than the photos suggested, but was clean and everything worked
Avoided breakfast after reading reviews
Staff refused to call our transfer number (we had no mobile signal in Turkey) so we opted for a taxi
Bar opposite the entrance is a brothel as we found out having refreshments outside and my 13 yr old and I were approached 3 times
data.title: Beware of the Brothel
